text:
(1) Stapleton, Staten Island: A general view eastward across the town and piers on the Upper New York Bay. In the center of the view is visible the Rubsam and Horrmann Atlantic Brewery; to its left is the funnel of an ice manufacturing plant. In the foreground is a children's playground on the east side of Targee Street, where a municipal courthouse was later erected. The piers, counting from left to right, begin with No. 12 and continue in arithmetic progression. The view is from the hill above Van Duzer Street.

Mid 1920's

P. L. Sperr

(2) Viewing across Stapleton, in a slightly more northerly direction, towards Tompkinsville; The piers counting from right to left in arithmetic regression, begin with No. 14. On the extreme left is Van Duzer Street; running parallel to it is Targee Street, and in the center of the view, running uphill, is Grove Street.

Mid 1920's

P. L. Sperr

(3) The Rubsam and Horrmann Brewery (right) and the stack of the ice plant, seen from Van Duzer Street.

July 8, 1932

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond:] Staten Island - Stapleton - [Rubsam and Horrmann Brewery].

original_title: Richmond: Van Duzer Street - Targee Street
text:
535 to 523 Van Duzer Street, east side, at Targee Street, looking north. No. 525, the very old frame house, is occupied(in part) by the Eagle Social Club.

July 8, 1932

P. L. Sperr
